text:
Dear,

OS Windows 2003 Standart edition
Apache version 5.0.28
Application Peregrine ServiceCenter 6.1.3.

First urgent problem.
After installing the following patches:
KB931784
KB932168

The Web application shutdown unexpectly or is given a error page, when restart 
the service in the Windows Service Console application refused to start.
Only a hard reboot can fix this problem.
This happened frequently as of the patch day on Saturday.

As follow up for this problem, when we restart the complete server with a RDP 
connection it seems to be going well.
RDP connection will get disconnected but Server will not come up again, when I 
look into it with IPMI console I see that the server is not rebooted completely.

I upgraded to version 5.0.30 but it seems to be still in beta status and we are 
not be able to use application in beta status.

Because of the URL it is a internal URL in Philips I am not be able to provide 
you a link.
creator: willem.van.der.vliet@philips.com

text:
I would not expect OS patch such as these to have any impact on Tomcat. The JVM
should insulate Tomcat from such issues and therefore I do not believe this is a
Tomcat issue.

An upgrade to the latest Sun JVM may help.

Since it appears you take security issues seriously you might also want to
consider the unpatched vulnerabilities in Tomcat 5.0.x. See
http://tomcat.apache.org/security-5.html for details. Even with 5.0.30, there
are at least 3 important vulnerabilities. An upgrade to the latest 5.5.x would
resolve these.

If you need further assistance with this issue please use the Tomcat users
mailing list.
creator: markt@apache.org
